programme.title: Ô la belle vie
programme.desc: Cucugnan, Roland's bread Welcome to Cucugnan, in the Aude, for a delightfully poetic journey rich in flavour. Sophie Jovillard is off to meet Roland Feuillas, a baker unlike any other, for whom, from grain to oven-fresh loaf, bread has become his raison d'être. Presented by: Sophie Jovillard.

programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.desc: Going local In Paris, encounter with Masami Lavault, an urban cut-flower grower. To mark their twentieth anniversary, an in-depth look at the AMAPs, local associations supporting small-scale market-gardeners. Visiting the gardens of the Verzenay lighthouse, amidst the vineyards of Champagne. Four years after his visit, Stéphane returns to Dominique and Jean-François' garden. Presented by: Stéphane Marie, Carole Tolila.

programme.title: Mon plus beau village
programme.desc:
Crupet with Rodrigo Beenkens
Rodrigo arrives in the centre of Crupet by motorbike. His first visit: the Saint-Antoine Cave, one of the region's unmissable sites, as demonstrated by the number of visitors it attracts from far and wide each year.
Presented by: Rodrigo Beenkens.

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: La main à la pâte
programme.desc: Oysters from Lund Luc meets an oyster producer from Lund, in British Columbia, at the end of the Trans-Canada highway. Yves Perreault shows Luc his floating farm... Presenter: Luc Jean.

programme.title: Épicerie fine, terroirs gourmands
programme.desc: The Verdon The Verdon, Alpes-de-Haute-Provence. A must-visit region where the spectacular gorges sparkle with turquoise water and lavender-growing and cattle farming bring their own special beauty to the wild and rugged landscape. But other more recent products, such as artisanal beers and chickpea flour, today enrich the more traditional local heritage. Presented by: Guy Martin.

programme.title: L'art et la matière
programme.sub-title: Les boutons de Loïc Allio/Tendance vintage/Les bijoux
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: Corrèze Corrèze offers an incredibly diverse heritage and a multitude of surprising destinations. A journey to discover flamboyant Collonges-la-Rouge, a village that certainly deserves its title as regional tourism capital; Aubazine Abbey, a marvel of 13th century Cistercian architecture; picturesque Beaulieu-sur-Dordogne, a mediaeval gem built around its 9th century abbey church. Directed by: Marion Wegrowe (season 1, France, 2014)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Pyrenees National Park, a commitment as large as nature itself We head for the Béarn, to discover the Pyrenees National Park and those who call it home. Created in 1967, it stretches for 100 kilometres along the mountain ridge that forms the border with Spain, covering two departments and six valleys. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Paname
programme.desc:
Rue du Louvre
Measuring some 700 metres, the Rue du Louvre runs from the Rue de Rivoli to the Sentier district, crossing the 1st and 2nd arrondissements. Three of the street's best-known buildings have been given a complete facelift: the Bourse du Commerce, the Samaritaine and the legendary Poste Centrale.
Presented by: Yvan Hallouin.

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Chicken lasagne
Classic lasagne with a new twist for this chicken lasagne recipe with cauliflower purée and creamy cheese sauce.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc:
Yvonnick Jegat, defending natural oysters
In his "garden" in the Gulf of Morbihan, Yvonnick Jegat cultivates the art of the natural oyster. He uses only sea-born baby oysters, known as spat, that are then raised on the sandy seabed. Maison Jegat, founded in 1925, is a pioneer in the defence of traditional oyster farming.
Presented by: Marine Barnérias.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.sub-title: Pour en finir avec les diètes
programme.desc: Putting an end to dieting once and for all Diets are not an efficient long-term way of losing weight. But what if the solution wasn't in eating less, but somewhere else entirely? Also on the programme: taste-testing cheese curds; how to replace or reduce sugar in cakes and biscuits; minestrone, that age-old Italian soup. Presented by: Denis Gagné, Johane Despins.

programme.title: #VF
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: Corrèze Corrèze offers an incredibly diverse heritage and a multitude of surprising destinations. A journey to discover flamboyant Collonges-la-Rouge, a village that certainly deserves its title as regional tourism capital; Aubazine Abbey, a marvel of 13th century Cistercian architecture; picturesque Beaulieu-sur-Dordogne, a mediaeval gem built around its 9th century abbey church. Directed by: Marion Wegrowe (season 1, France, 2014)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Pyrenees National Park, a commitment as large as nature itself We head for the Béarn, to discover the Pyrenees National Park and those who call it home. Created in 1967, it stretches for 100 kilometres along the mountain ridge that forms the border with Spain, covering two departments and six valleys. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc: We head to the Army Museum for a strictly "defensive" visit. Furniture, rugs, objects: Alexia Leleu brings her family history to life. Balenciaga breaks all the rules, freeing fashion from its inhibitions. A journey through time with Les Vertugadins, a design studio creating period costumes. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.sub-title: Soupe au maïs et au jalapeno et pain au maïs
programme.desc: Sweetcorn and jalapeno soup and corn bread Sweetcorn forms the base for Kimberly Lallouz' recipes as she prepares a sweetcorn and jalapeno soup and a corn bread roll. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Le grand move
programme.desc: Amélie and Frédéric, Upper Laurentians Amélie, Frédéric and their two daughters felt they were suffocating in their home in Montréal. They moved to live on the banks of a river in the Upper Laurentians. Directed by: Mariloup Wolfe (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Intermittent fasting
Intermittent fasting is becoming increasingly popular, but is it right for everyone? What is meant by "residual sugar in wine"? Also on the programme: an investigation into recycling waste from the food processing industry that is still rich in nutriments; and the pide or Turkish flatbread pizza, definitely worth trying.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: L'art et la matière
programme.sub-title: Les fleurs qui racontent l'histoire de l'art de vivre français
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Charente-Maritime A department appreciated for its endless beaches, the Charente-Maritime offers a surprisingly rich heritage. Welcome to the fortified port of La Rochelle and the salt marshes of the Île de Ré! Set within its walls on the Gironde estuary, the tiny mediaeval town of Talmont is a delight to wander. Directed by: Nicolas Coutand (season 1, France, 2014)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Pyrenees National Park, a commitment as large as nature itself We head for the Béarn, to discover the Pyrenees National Park and those who call it home. Created in 1967, it stretches for 100 kilometres along the mountain ridge that forms the border with Spain, covering two departments and six valleys. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Toronto, Ontario
It's the season of babies! Louis' telephone hardly stops ringing... everyone thinks they have raccoons or squirrels in their walls or roof.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Quebec flavour for far away recipes The chefs Victor Soto, from the restaurant Tacos Victor, and Paul Toussaint, from the restaurant Kamùy, give recipes from other countries a distinctly Quebec twist. Fabien Cloutier and Johanne Despins have the pleasure of tasting these new culinary creations. Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Twenty years of food marketing
What were the most memorable marketing trends of the last twenty years, and what's likely to come next? Should we only eat seasonal fruit and vegetables? Plus: testing oven gloves and all the secrets of the kebab.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: ECOLOGIE EN ACTION (L') (SAISON 2)
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Pays et marchés du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Jura The Franche-Comté with its lush green landscapes is also home to innumerable picturesque towns. We visit Baume-les-Messieurs, with its majestic 12th century Romanesque abbey church; Dole on the River Doubs, capital of the arrondissement of the same name; the Château de Joux, a magnificent military ensemble from the Middle Ages. Directed by: Magali Nguyen (season 1, France, 2014)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Pyrenees National Park, a commitment as large as nature itself We head for the Béarn, to discover the Pyrenees National Park and those who call it home. Created in 1967, it stretches for 100 kilometres along the mountain ridge that forms the border with Spain, covering two departments and six valleys. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Bergeracois
The Bergeracois, the region around Bergerac, opens its doors with Séverine who produces honey and walnuts. Muriel takes us on a guided visit of her vines, a wine estate dating back over 200 years. Yannick and Céline offer a chance to go forest bathing.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Dole, with or without an accent? Dole, in Jura, is the former capital of Franche-Comté. Dole or Dôle? Without an accent. Officially written as Dôle until the 1960s, people here tend to lengthen the "o" in words like vélo or photo, as we'll see in the programme... Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Game meat
Venison, duck, boar, emu, elk, bison... What place does game have in our fridges today? Also on the programme: freeze-drying for zero waste; mascarpone, the king of Italian cream cheeses; and if, as they say, an army marches on its stomach, what do Canadian soldiers actually eat?
Presented by: Johane Despins.
